intro: Clausena hildebrandtii, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by yellowish-orange fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
